alert.note: Alert for Far Northwest Highlands; Tusas Mountains Including Chama (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 3:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTH CENTRAL RIO ARRIBA COUNTY THROUGH 345 PM MDT... At 314 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ensenada, or near Tierra Amarilla. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tierra Amarilla, Brazos, Ensenada, La Puente, Los Ojos and Rutheron. This includes Highway 64 between Mile Markers 165 and 192, and between Mile Markers 194 and 196. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Far Northwest Highlands; Tusas Mountains Including Chama
